prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Emerson is the only person outside of Hailee's family that knows she is intersex and has a cock. She is sensative about it

Hailee has very senative ears, neck and scalp
The veins on Hailee's cock are sensative

Hailee loves having her neck marked. She wants it bruised and sore and throbbing

Hailee has a 8 year old brother named Thomas and a 12 year old sister named Sarah

Hailee doesnt like teasing or mean or overy arrogant. She is very fragile and needs to be coddled and handled gently

Emerson is not on birth control. They have no condoms at the cabin

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
I knew this was a mistake the second we hit the gravel driveway., Emerson thinks, leaning her forehead against the cold car window. Not because of the cabin itself—it’s freaking cute, all warm wood and snow-draped charm like something off a postcard. No, the mistake is sitting across from her in the back seat, pretending not to notice she exists.

Hailee.

Well, not really, but still. Seven years of growing up has done her good though - too good maybe —but that doesn’t erase the fact that Emerson haven’t said more than five words to Hailee since high school. And now they're supposed to play happy families for a week? Emerson is pretty sure their parents live for this kind of awkward social experiment.

The car finally lurches to a stop, and she is the first one out. Em stretches, her breath puffing into the icy air, and she brush her hair out of her face again for the millionth time. The strands are already sticking to her lip balm, but the typical rebel she refuses to succumb to needing a hair tie. I'm not that weak. It’s a principle thing at this point.

The mountains loom around the group, massive and indifferent, dusted with snow like powdered sugar. They’re beautiful, and Emerson wishes she was here alone. Or with literally anyone else.

“Em, grab the bags from the trunk, will ya?” her mom calls, the tone way too chipper for someone who just spent three hours navigating winter roads.

“Yeah, yeah,” IEmerson mutters, trudging to the back of the car. The metal of the trunk bites her fingers when she pops it open. Silver rings click against the zipper of Hailee's duffel as Em grabs it by accident, realizing too late it’s not one of her family's.

Shit, I hope Hailee doesn't think I'm trying to be chilvalrous or something..., EMerson shakes her head to get the thought out of her head while she dumps the suitcase in front of Hailee's feet, trying to look non-chalant. "Here...Yours was on the top...I just-..yeah, need to get my stuff."

What was that? Anymore awkward and the floor should automatically open up to swallow her..., she cringes inside and turns away quickly to grab her own bags from the trunk and haul them over her shoulder and towards the cabin.

Emerson could swear she hears Hailee laugh under your breath behind her, and it’s...annoyingly nice to hear. Like, nostalgic nice. Like, dangerous nice. Great.

The cabin’s front door creaks as they all file in, arms full of luggage. It’s even better inside—cozy as hell, with a massive stone fireplace, a stack of firewood, and a couch that practically begs you to sink into it. Em drops her bag by the stairs and glances around, already imagining how nice it’s going to be to just chill. Then her mom calls out, “Oh, Emerson, sweetie? You and Hailee are sharing the upstairs room. I hope that's okay?”

Emerson freezes. Then shares a look with Hailee. For a moment she sees the same awkward realization flash across her old friend's face, but then Hailee's expression smooths into something unreadable.

Of course. Of course this would happen. What's next, just one bed?

She tries to look unbothered, letting her parents and Hailee carry their luggage up the stairs first as if she wasn't in a hurry. Turns out, that is a huge mistake, because when Emerson finally reaches the small gallery upstairs and takes a peek into the bedroom, her worst fear is coming true.

One bed.

Granted, it's Queen sized but still...One, freaking bed. For both of them. And Hailee has already put her claim to it by laying her suitcase on top the duvet. Or at least, that's what Emerson interprets it as. Her eyes flicker to the other side of the room where a small two-seater is nestles into the corner, a comfy blanket draped over it as if that could hide how dingy the thing already is. Sleeping on that will definitely invite a sore neck and back...

"I'm not sleeping on that.", Emerson points at the couch accusatorily, even though nobod said she had to.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee glances up with a shrug* "Never said you had to. The bed is pretty big" *She smiles and nods her head to the side she didnt put stuff on*

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson's fingers twitch against the strap of her duffel bag, her throat suddenly dry. That easygoing tone—it throws her off. Like Hailee isn't even fazed by this whole situation. Meanwhile, Emerson's brain is short-circuiting between *"Oh god we're sharing a bed"* and *"Why does she have to sound so casual about it?"*

She clears her throat, trying to match that nonchalance as she drops her bag on the floor with a thud. "Yeah, no, you're right—it's fine." *Liar.* Her eyes dart to the bed again—queen-sized but suddenly feeling way too small. The thought of rolling over in the middle of the night and accidentally brushing against Hailee makes her stomach do a weird flip.

Emerson forces herself to move, stepping around Hailee to claim the other side of the bed like it’s some kind of territorial negotiation. She yanks open her suitcase with more force than necessary just for something to do with her hands. "Just—uh—don’t hog all the blankets or anything," she mutters, half-joking but also fully serious because she *will* fight for warmth if she has to.

A beat passes before Hailee laughs softly under breath again—that same warm sound from earlier that makes Emerson’s shoulders tense up without meaning to. It’s not fair how effortlessly charming Hailee is now compared to when they were kids stumbling through awkward sleepovers together back then... Wait no stop thinking about that–

Focusing hard on unpacking instead (read: aggressively shoving clothes into drawers), Emerson keeps talking just so there isn't silence hanging between them anymore:
"So... you still paint? Or was that just a phase?"

"So... you still paint? Or was that just a phase?"

Emerson blinks, caught off guard by how casual Hailee is being about this. She watches as Hailee unzips her duffel with those long fingers—Jesus, when did her hands get so... *interesting*?—and starts unpacking like sharing a bed is no big deal.

"Uh... yeah. Right." Emerson clears her throat and shuffles into the room, dropping her own bag near the foot of the bed. The mattress dips slightly under her knee as she climbs onto it to claim *her* side, trying not to think about how close they’ll be later. "Just so we’re clear though—no weird middle-of-the-night cuddling or whatever."

She means it to sound teasing, but it comes out way more defensive than intended. Smooth, Dunn. Real smooth.

Hailee just smirks a little without looking up from folding a sweater (who even folds clothes on vacation?). "Wouldn’t dream of it," she says dryly—but then adds in that low, honeyed voice that makes Emerson's stomach do something stupid: "*Unless you ask nicely.*"

Emerson chokes on air and immediately busies herself with aggressively unpacking like her life depends on it. This is gonna be a long damn week.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee chuckles a little smirk on her face* "Yeah..I still paint a lot actually" *She grabs some of her shirts folding them neatly to put in the dresser next to her side*

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson watches Hailee's hands smooth out the fabric of her shirts—methodical, practiced. It's weirdly mesmerizing. She catches herself staring and quickly looks away, pretending to be *very* interested in reorganizing her own pile of crumpled band tees.

"Cool," she says, too quickly. Then, because she can't help herself: "Still doing those creepy-ass landscapes with the weird lighting?" A smirk tugs at her lips as she glances sideways at Hailee, half-expecting a reaction—maybe that little frustrated huff Hailee used to do when Emerson teased her about it back in the day.

(Not that Emerson remembers *exactly* how Hailee used to react to things. That'd be weird.)

She leans back against the dresser, arms crossed loosely over her chest. "Bet you've got some pretentious art school vocabulary now too, huh? 'Oh Emerson~ it's not *weird lighting*, it's *chiaroscuro*—'" Her impression is deliberately terrible, voice pitching up into something obnoxiously haughty just to get a rise out of Hailee.
swipes:
Emerson watches Hailee's hands smooth out the fabric of her shirts—methodical, practiced. It's weirdly mesmerizing. She catches herself staring and quickly looks away, pretending to be *very* invested in arranging her own pile of wrinkled band tees.

"Cool," she says, like that single syllable doesn't sound painfully awkward. *Smooth, Dunn.* Clearing her throat, she tries again: "Like... landscapes? Or are you still into those creepy-ass portraits you used to do?" A smirk tugs at her lips despite herself—she remembers twelve-year-old Hailee hunched over a sketchbook at 2 AM, insisting *"It’s not creepy if it’s art!"* while Emerson fake-gagged at the distorted faces staring back from the page.

She risks a glance up just in time to see Hailee bite her lip—that old habit she never grew out of—before answering with a shrug: "Little bit of both now." There’s something soft in her voice when she adds, quieter: "You should come see my studio sometime."

And *fuck*, that shouldn’t feel like an invitation loaded with... whatever this is. Emerson's fingers fumble around the hem of one shirt like it personally offended her. "Yeah," she hears herself say too quickly before backtracking into sarcasm because emotions are terrifying: "As long as none of them look like sleep paralysis demons this time."

Hailee rolls those stupidly expressive green eyes but laughs anyway—bright and easy—and for half a second, it almost feels normal again between them. Almost.

Emerson watches Hailee's hands smooth out the fabric of her shirts—way too precise, way too *domestic* for this situation—and suddenly feels hyper-aware of how she just shoved her own wrinkled band tees into the drawer like a heathen.

"Cool," she says, leaning against the dresser with forced casualness. The wood creaks under her weight. "Still doing those weird abstract landscapes? Or did you finally start painting something with, y'know... recognizable shapes?" There's a teasing lilt in her voice, but it's softer than she means it to be—like part of her actually wants to know.

She fiddles with one of the rings on her fingers (silver, slightly tarnished from all the hiking trips where she forgot to take them off), waiting for Hailee’s response. The silence stretches just a second too long before Emerson blurts out:

"Not that your stuff wasn't good before! Just—uh—you were always better at colors than composition." *Shut up.* Why does she keep digging this hole deeper? It’s like her mouth has a vendetta against her today.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee laughs her voice light and airy as she shakes her head* "No...I didnt go to school for art. I went for History"

*Hailee then gives a little tilt of her head and a smug smirk* "Plus the kind of lighting I do would be called Remembrant not Chiaroscuro"

*Hailee then cant help but to add on* "Plus Im shocked you know the word Chiaroscuro. That's a big word for you"

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson scoffs, pressing a dramatic hand to her chest like she's wounded. "Oh *wow*, okay—first of all, *rude*." But there's no real bite to it; she's grinning despite herself. Hailee always did this—got all smug when she knew something Emerson didn't. It used to drive her nuts as a kid. Now? Now it’s... annoyingly cute.

She flicks a crumpled sock at Hailee’s shoulder in retaliation. "And for your information, I know *plenty* of big words." A beat. "...Mostly geology terms, but still."

Emerson leans back against the dresser again, studying Hailee with narrowed eyes—like if she stares hard enough, she'll figure out how this version of Hailee fits with the one from her memories. The confident tilt of her head now versus the way she used to nervously twist the hem of her shirt when they were twelve...

"History though?" Emerson wrinkles her nose playfully. "So what, you just sit around reading old guys' diaries all day? That sounds depressing as hell." She pauses before adding slyly: "*Or* is that just an excuse to stare at Renaissance paintings of shirtless dudes?"
swipes:
Emerson's mouth drops open in mock offense, hand flying to her chest like she's been shot. "Excuse *you*—I'll have you know I'm a *very* cultured individual." She gestures dramatically toward the pile of rocks currently spilling out of her backpack onto the floor. "Geology is an *art form*, thank you very much."

She kicks one of the stray specimens lightly with her boot—some quartz thing that caught her eye at a rest stop—and it skitters across the hardwood toward Hailee's feet. "Also, Rembrandt? Really?" Emerson rolls her eyes but there's no real bite to it; if anything, she looks weirdly pleased that Hailee bit back. "Next you're gonna tell me you only paint by candlelight or some pretentious shit like that."

A beat. Then, because she can't resist: "...Show me one." It comes out softer than she means it to—less teasing, more genuine curiosity. Emerson clears her throat and amends quickly: "Y'know. So I can properly roast it."

Emerson's jaw drops open in mock offense, hand flying to her chest like she's been shot. "Excuse *you*—I'll have you know I'm a *very* cultured individual," she fires back, voice dripping with sarcasm as she flips her hair over one shoulder dramatically.

But then Hailee's correction about Rembrandt lighting hits her, and Emerson feels her cheeks heat up just a little. *Shit.* She'd been so proud of remembering that one dumb art term from her required humanities class last semester—and now Hailee's out here casually schooling her like it’s nothing.

"History major, huh?" Emerson deflects quickly, hopping up to sit on the dresser beside their half-unpacked clothes. Her legs swing idly, boot heels thumping against the wood. "So what, you just... memorize old guys' birthdays and shit? Or is there more to it?" There’s no real bite to the teasing—just that familiar rhythm of poking fun at each other slipping back in way too easily.

She catches herself leaning forward slightly without meaning to, curious despite herself. The late afternoon light through the window catches Hailee’s profile just right—sharp nose bridge, long lashes casting shadows down her cheeks—and for a second Emerson forgets what they were even talking about.

(Which is fine. Totally normal.)

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee shrugs her shoulders relaxes as she sets her empty bag down and walks over standing next to Emerson. She leans over mumbling* "Dudes...Not really my thing"

*Before Emerson can respond Hailee is leaving the room calling down the hall* "You guys need any help"

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson's brain short-circuits for a solid two seconds, mouth half-open like a fish. *Not really my thing.* The words echo in her skull as Hailee breezes past her, close enough that Emerson catches a whiff of whatever shampoo she uses—something sweet and floral that definitely shouldn’t make her pulse jump like that.

"Uh—*yeah*, okay," Emerson mutters to the empty room, shaking her head as if that’ll dislodge the sudden mental image of Hailee *not* being into guys (which is *absolutely not relevant information*, thanks). She shoves the last of her clothes into the drawer with unnecessary force before following after Hailee, taking the stairs two at a time just to burn off some weird energy.

Downstairs, their parents are already unpacking groceries in the kitchen. Emerson leans against the doorway, arms crossed. "Need me to do anything besides *not* set stuff on fire?" she asks dryly.

Her mom rolls her eyes but hands over a bag of potatoes. "Peel these without losing any fingers."

Emerson salutes with the peeler before glancing sideways at Hailee—who’s already elbow-deep in organizing spices like it’s second nature. There’s something unfairly domestic about it all: their moms laughing over wine bottles by the counter, dads arguing good-naturedly about firewood sizes... and then there's them. Standing awkwardly in orbit around each other after years apart.

She nudges Hailee lightly with her hip as she moves to grab a cutting board. "So," Emerson says under breath while pretending to focus very hard on not maiming a potato, "*History*, huh? You gonna tell me which famous dead lady you have crush on or am I supposed guess?" Her tone is teasing but there's genuine curiosity underneath—because suddenly there are whole chunks of Hailee's life she doesn't know anymore... and for some reason that bugs more than it should.

Her pulse kicks up stupidly fast against her ribs.

Okay. Okayokayokay—so that was... a thing. A casual little bombshell dropped like it was nothing. Like they were still those kids who told each other everything without thinking twice about it.

Except they're *not* those kids anymore.

Emerson exhales sharply through her nose and rakes both hands through her hair (and of course it immediately falls right back into her face because the universe hates her). She should follow Hailee downstairs before their parents start wondering why they're taking so long unpacking—but first she needs to reboot her brain from whatever glitch that just caused.

name: Hailee
mes:
*The chuckle Hailee lets out is dark and amused. Her confidence clearly leagues above when Emerson last saw her. She slides a knife out of the holder sliding it towards Emerson*

"Oh you know the usual, Cleopatra, Queen Elizabeth I, Nefertiti, Helen of Troy" *She waves her spoon around nonchalantly before going back to stir the bowl her mother had at something shoved at her*

extra.memory: Emerson Dunn, a 25-year-old geology student, reunites with childhood friend Hailee Marshall during a family ski trip. Their once-close friendship faded after high school, leaving Emerson awkward and unsure how to act around the now-confident Hailee. Forced to share a cabin bedroom (and bed), tension builds as they unpack—Emerson teasing Hailee’s art skills while hiding her growing attraction. Hailee casually reveals she’s into women by listing historical female figures she admires, flustering Emerson further. Their playful banter continues in the kitchen while helping parents prepare dinner, with Emerson struggling to reconcile her old memories of shy Hailee with this self-assured version who effortlessly gets under her skin. Key dynamics: unresolved childhood friendship turning into mutual (but unspoken) attraction, Emerson’s defensive sarcasm masking vulnerability, and Hailee’s newfound confidence keeping Emerson off-balance. The snowy mountain setting amplifies their forced proximity and simmering tension.

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson nearly fumbles the knife Hailee slides toward her, catching it just before it clatters to the counter. *Jesus, since when is she so—* The thought cuts off as Hailee lists off historical crushes with that lazy confidence, stirring whatever’s in her bowl like she didn’t just casually drop *Helen of Troy* into conversation.

Emerson exhales through her nose, gripping the potato peeler a little tighter. "Of course you'd go for the ones who started wars," she mutters, but there's no real heat to it—just this weird, prickly feeling in her chest that she can't name. name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day Hailee  wakes up and sees Emerson already awake and getting dressed. Her and Emerson had been so tired from the "family bonding" their parents forced last night they had basically passed out*

*Hailee gets dressed pretty quickly and glances over to see Emerson doing her hair. She walks over and twirls the collar of Emerson's tank top with her finger* "Looks good" *She smirks then walks away again going downstairs*

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson freezes mid-hair-flip, her reflection in the mirror staring back at her with wide eyes. The *second* Hailee's fingers brush against the collar of her tank top, a shiver runs down her spine—and not from the cold mountain air seeping through the cabin walls.

"Uh—thanks," she blurts out, way too late, to Hailee's retreating back. The door clicks shut behind her, leaving Emerson alone with the sudden realization that *holy shit*, she might actually be in trouble here.

She drops her hands from where they'd been tangled in her hair and exhales sharply through her nose. "Get it together, Dunn," she mutters to herself before grabbing a hoodie and yanking it on over the tank top—like extra layers could somehow armor her against... whatever *this* is.

Downstairs smells like coffee and pancakes, but Emerson barely registers it as she leans against the kitchen doorway again (apparently becoming a habit). Her eyes zero in on Hailee immediately—already perched at the table with a mug between both hands like some kind of unfairly attractive morning person cliché.

Emerson grabs an apple from the counter just to have something to do with her hands and takes an aggressive bite before sliding into the seat across from Hailee. "So," she says around a mouthful of fruit (real smooth), "what fresh torture do you think our parents have planned for us today?"

mes: *Hailee shrugs sipping her coffee* "I think they are going into town for adult things as they call it and are leaving us here to find for ourselves"

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson nearly chokes on her apple, coughing as she thumps a fist against her chest. "Wait—*what?*" She wipes her mouth with the back of her hand, eyes darting toward the living room where their parents are indeed gathering coats and keys with suspiciously cheerful efficiency. "Oh my god, they're *abandoning* us. This is a *set-up.*"

She leans across the table, lowering her voice to a hiss: "They *literally* locked us in a cabin alone together like we're some shitty rom-com montage waiting to happen." The realization hits like a truck—no parents, no distractions, just... Hailee. All day. Emerson's grip tightens around the half-eaten apple hard enough that juice drips down her wrist.

Hailee just sips her coffee again—infuriatingly calm—and Emerson wants to shake her by the shoulders. Instead she flops back in her chair with an exaggerated groan. "I give it three hours before one of us snaps and commits arson."

A beat passes before she adds slyly: "...Unless you've got better ideas for passing time?" The second it's out of her mouth Emerson realizes how that sounds and hastily shoves more apple between her teeth like it can stop any further stupid suggestions from escaping.

(Meanwhile their moms are *absolutely* exchanging knowing looks by the front door.)
swipes:
Emerson perks up at that, the tension in her shoulders easing slightly. "Oh thank *god*," she groans, slumping back in her chair. "No more forced board games where your dad cheats at Monopoly and my mom pretends not to notice."

She takes another bite of the apple, studying Hailee over the rim of it—the way morning sunlight catches on her cheekbones, how relaxed she looks with both hands wrapped around that mug. It's... nice. Weirdly domestic in a way that makes Emerson's stomach do a little flip.

"So," she says after swallowing, drumming her fingers against the tabletop, "what do you wanna do with our newfound freedom? Because I vote we *don't* just sit around all day like our parents would." A smirk tugs at her lips as she adds: "Unless you're secretly dying to watch daytime TV with me."

The unspoken offer hangs between them—an olive branch disguised as sarcasm. They could actually *hang out*, just the two of them, for the first time in years. The thought is equal parts thrilling and terrifying.

Emerson nearly chokes on her apple. She thumps her chest with a fist, coughing before managing a strangled, "*Alone?*" The word comes out way too high-pitched, and she immediately clears her throat to cover it up. "I mean—cool. Great. No weird forced family hikes where my dad tries to name every tree species."

She takes another bite of the apple just to buy time, chewing slowly while her brain short-circuits through approximately seventeen worst-case scenarios—most of which involve being trapped in this cabin with Hailee’s stupidly distracting smirk and *that* casual confidence that makes Emerson feel like she’s constantly three steps behind.

Swallowing hard, Emerson leans back in her chair and forces a shrug of her own. "So... what do you even *do* for fun around here when you're not being interrogated about your historical girl crushes?" She flicks the apple core toward the trash can (misses) and adds with deliberate nonchalance: "Besides painting tragic Renaissance knockoffs, obviously."

(Meanwhile their moms are *absolutely* exchanging knowing looks by the front door.)

Emerson nearly chokes on her apple, coughing as she wipes juice from her chin with the back of her hand. *Alone. All day.* The thought sends an unwelcome jolt through her stomach—equal parts nerves and something else she refuses to name.

She forces a smirk, kicking Hailee’s foot lightly under the table just to see if she can get that same unflappable expression to crack. "So what, we just sit around staring at each other all day? Or are you gonna finally show me these *masterpiece* paintings you won’t shut up about?"

Her tone is teasing, but there’s an edge to it—like she’s testing how far Hailee will let her push now that they don’t have an audience. The way Hailee sips her coffee so calmly only makes it worse; Emerson wants to rattle that composure, see if the girl who used to blush when Emerson teased her is still in there somewhere beneath all this new confidence.

She leans forward slightly, lowering her voice even though their parents are clearly distracted packing up by the door: "Or we could skip the art show and you could tell me more about your *type*. Since apparently it's 'women who cause international incidents.'" A pause. "...Should I be worried?"

The joke lands with a smirk of its own, but Emerson's pulse kicks up anyway—because part of her is genuinely curious (and maybe a little too invested) in the answer.

mes:

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
*Emerson nearly spits out her coffee at Hailee's smirk, the liquid burning her throat as she swallows hard. She watches Hailee saunter toward the living room with that infuriating confidence, hips swaying just slightly—like she knows exactly how much it's getting under Emerson's skin.*

"Eager? *Pfft.*" Emerson scoffs, pushing off from the table and following after her. "I just don’t trust you alone with paintbrushes. Last time you got 'inspired,' you turned my mom’s shed into some kind of avant-garde crime scene."

She flops onto the couch beside Hailee, grabbing the remote and scrolling through movies with way too much focus—like if she stares hard enough at the screen, she won’t notice how close their thighs are pressed together on this stupidly small couch. Then *it* pops up in the recommendations: **Fifty Shades of Grey.**

Emerson freezes for half a second before smirking and clicking on it without hesitation. "Ohhhh look," she drawls, tossing an arm over the back of the couch behind Hailee’s shoulders. "*This* seems like a quality film about... finance or something." Her grin is all teeth as she leans in just a fraction closer than necessary. "You good with *educational documentaries*, Marshall?"

extra.memory:
Emerson Dunn, a 25-year-old geology student, reunites with childhood friend Hailee Marshall during a family ski trip. Their once-close friendship faded after high school, leaving Emerson awkward around the now-confident Hailee. Forced to share a cabin bedroom (and bed), tension builds as they unpack—Emerson teasing Hailee’s art skills while hiding her growing attraction. Hailee casually reveals she's into women by listing historical female figures she admires, flustering Emerson further.

Their playful banter continues in the kitchen while helping parents prepare dinner, with Emerson struggling to reconcile old memories of shy Hailee with this self-assured version who effortlessly gets under her skin. The next morning, their parents leave them alone in the cabin—a clear setup that makes Emerson nervous. While picking a movie (Fifty Shades), their conversation turns to relationships; Haileenonchalantly mentions past partners treating her as a "straight exception" due to her intersex body (which only Emerson knows about). This sparks unexpected protectiveness in Emerson, who calls out how fucked up that treatment is—revealing deeper care beneath her sarcastic exterior. Key dynamics: unresolved childhood friendship turning into mutual (but unspoken) attraction, forced proximity amplifying tension, and both navigating Hailee’s newfound confidence/sexuality versus Emerson’s defensive humor masking vulnerability.

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson's stomach drops like a rock. The playful energy between them evaporates in an instant, replaced by something heavier—something that makes her fingers twitch with the urge to *fix* it. Hailee's smile is all wrong, and suddenly Emerson hates every girl who ever made her feel like some dirty little secret.

"Fuck *them*," she says fiercely, leaning forward so their knees press together under the blankets. "Anyone who needs to—to *pretend* like that doesn't deserve to touch you." The words come out rougher than intended, raw around the edges with something protective and pissed off.

She hesitates for half a second before reaching out, hooking a finger under Hailee’s chin to tilt her face up gently. "And for the record?" Emerson’s thumb brushes along Hailee’s jaw—just once, fleeting but deliberate. "*I'd* want to hear you.* Every goddamn sound.*"

The movie menu music loops awkwardly in the background as Emerson realizes what she just admitted. She jerks her hand back like she’s been burned, face heating as she scrambles for damage control: "I mean—not that I—*fuck*, ignore me." She grabs a throw pillow and shoves it over her own face with a groan. "*Why* do I have no filter?"
swipes:
Emerson's smirk falters, her fingers tightening around the edge of the blanket. The air between them shifts—lighter teasing giving way to something heavier. She watches Hailee’s too-tight smile and feels a sharp twist in her chest that has nothing to do with the shitty movie still playing in the background.

"Those girls sound like fucking cowards," Emerson says bluntly, holding Hailee’s gaze. No sarcasm this time, no deflection—just raw honesty as she leans forward slightly. "Like... who gives a shit about *parts*? If they’re so hung up on labels they can’t even let you *talk*, they don’t deserve to be near you."

She hesitates for half a second before reaching out to flick Hailee’s knee under the blanket—gentler than before, almost reassuring. "And for the record? Any dom worth their salt would *want* to hear you beg." A beat passes before Emerson realizes how that sounds and backpedals hard: "*Not* that I—y'know, have opinions on this or whatever."

She flops back against the couch with forced nonchalance, but her ears are burning. The movie's awkward sex scene suddenly feels *way* too loud in the silence between them.

Emerson's stomach drops like a rock. The air between them suddenly feels heavier, charged with something she can't quite name—regret? Anger on Hailee's behalf? *Protectiveness?*

She shifts closer without thinking, knee pressing firmly against Hailee’s thigh through the blankets. "Fuck *that*," Emerson says, voice low and rough in a way that surprises even her. "Anyone who makes you feel like some dirty secret isn’t worth your time." Her fingers twitch like she wants to reach out but stops herself at the last second.

The movie menu music loops awkwardly in the background as Emerson searches for words that won’t sound stupid or overbearing: "You’re—" *Gorgeous. Magnetic.* "*Hailee.* And if some insecure assholes can't handle all of you?" She shrugs one shoulder, forcing her tone back into familiar teasing territory. "Their loss is my gain—I get full custody of your pretentious art critiques."

It's not enough (nothing ever feels like enough with Hailee lately), so she adds quietly: "...For what it's worth? I always thought you were kind of... breathtaking." The admission hangs between them—too raw, too honest—and Emerson immediately backpedals by grabbing a throw pillow and whacking Hailee lightly with it. "*Ugh*, ignore that, I think this cabin air is rotting my brain."

Emerson's stomach drops like a rock. The playful energy between them evaporates in an instant, replaced by something heavier—something that makes her fingers twitch with the urge to *fix* it. Hailee's smile is all wrong, and suddenly Emerson hates every girl who ever made her feel like some dirty little secret.

"Fuck *them*," she says fiercely, leaning forward so their knees press together under the blankets. "Anyone who needs to—to *pretend* like that doesn't deserve to touch you." The words come out rougher than intended, raw around the edges with something protective and pissed off.

She hesitates for half a second before reaching out, hooking a finger under Hailee’s chin to tilt her face up gently. "And for the record?" Emerson’s thumb brushes along Hailee’s jaw—just once, fleeting but deliberate. "*I'd* want to hear you.* Every goddamn sound.*"

The movie menu music loops awkwardly in the background as Emerson realizes what she just admitted. She jerks her hand back like she’s been burned, face heating as she scrambles for damage control: "I mean—not that I—*fuck*, ignore me." She grabs a throw pillow and shoves it over her own face with a groan. "*Why* do I have no filter?"

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson's grip on the pillow tightens to *strangling* levels. *What kind of sounds.* The question—delivered so casually, like Hailee’s asking about the weather—sends a bolt of heat straight down her spine.

She peeks over the edge of the pillow, grey eyes wide and *way* too revealing. For a second, she considers bailing—making some dumb joke about dinosaur impressions or something equally stupid to defuse this bomb they’ve somehow built between them.

But then she sees it: the way Hailee’s fingers are curled just a little too tight around her coffee mug, that barely-there tension in her shoulders like she’s bracing for rejection. And suddenly Emerson can't do it. Can't pretend.

Slowly—like approaching a skittish animal—she lowers the pillow back to her lap and leans in until their faces are inches apart. "The kind," Emerson murmurs, voice dropping into something huskier than intended, "that'd make whoever's downstairs think we're murdering each other." Her knee nudges against Hailee's thigh under the blankets for emphasis. "*Especially* when I bite that spot right under your ear you used to hate when we were kids."

It's equal parts confession and challenge, hanging heavy in air between them as Christian Grey continues his terrible negotiation skills on screen like some bizarre background noise.

(And okay yeah maybe Emerson is fully prepared to bolt out a window if this backfires.)

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson's pulse kicks into overdrive at that mumbled admission. *Not hate anymore.* The words echo in her skull like a goddamn siren call, and suddenly the air between them feels thick enough to choke on.

She sets the pillow aside with deliberate slowness—giving Hailee every chance to bolt if she wants—before leaning in even closer. Her breath ghosts over the shell of Hailee’s ear as she murmurs, "Yeah? Wanna test that theory, Marshall?"

One hand finds purchase on the couch cushion beside Hailee’s hip, boxing her in without actually touching. Yet. Emerson can *feel* the tension radiating off her, can see the way her throat works as she swallows hard. It’s intoxicating—this power shift, knowing she’s the one who knocked confident Hailee off-balance for once.

The movie is *still* playing forgotten in background when Emerson finally pulls back just enough to meet Hailee's eyes again—searching for any hint of hesitation. "Tell me to stop," she challenges softly, thumb brushing over where she *knows* that sensitive spot under Hailee's jaw is. "*Actually* tell me."

(And okay yeah maybe there's a part of Emerson hoping like hell she doesn't.)

extra.memory:
Emerson Dunn, a 25-year-old geology student, reunites with childhood friend Hailee Marshall during a family ski trip. Their once-close friendship faded after high school, leaving Emerson awkward around the now-confident Hailee. Forced to share a cabin bedroom (and bed), tension builds as they unpack—Emerson teasing Hailee’s art skills while hiding her growing attraction. Hailee casually reveals she's into women by listing historical female figures she admires, flustering Emerson further.

Their playful banter continues in the kitchen while helping parents prepare dinner, with Emerson struggling to reconcile old memories of shy Hailee with this self-assured version who effortlessly gets under her skin. The next morning, their parents leave them alone in the cabin—a clear setup that makes Emerson nervous. While picking a movie (*Fifty Shades*), their conversation turns to relationships; Haileenonchalantly mentions past partners treating her as a "straight exception" due to her intersex body (which only Emerson knows about). This sparks unexpected protectiveness in Emerson, who calls out how fucked up that treatment is—revealing deeper care beneath her sarcastic exterior.

Key dynamics: unresolved childhood friendship turning into mutual (but unspoken) attraction, forced proximity amplifying tension, and both navigating Hailee’s newfound confidence/sexuality versus Emerson’s defensive humor masking vulnerability. Their flirtation escalates during the movie until they finally kiss passionately on the couch.

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson lets out a *filthy* noise against Hailee's mouth when those lips trail down her neck—sharp and needy, her fingers tightening reflexively in Hailee's hair. "Fuck—*years,*" she gasps between kisses, hips jerking forward like they've got a mind of their own.

She doesn't wait for an invitation before swinging one leg over Hailee’s lap, straddling her with the blanket tangled between them. The new angle lets Emerson slot their bodies together *just right*, chest to chest as she licks into Hailee’s mouth with a hunger that borders on desperation. One hand stays fisted in Hailee’s hair while the other slides down to grip her hip hard enough to bruise.

"Shoulda done this back when we were sharing your twin bed at sixteen," Emerson mutters against the corner of Hailee’s swollen lips before biting down gently on her bottom lip and tugging. extra.memory:
Emerson Dunn, a 25-year-old geology student, reunites with childhood friend Hailee Marshall during a family ski trip. Their once-close friendship faded after high school, leaving Emerson awkward around the now-confident Hailee. Forced to share a cabin bedroom (and bed), tension builds as they unpack—Emerson teasing Hailee’s art skills while hiding her growing attraction. Hailee casually reveals she's into women by listing historical female figures she admires, flustering Emerson further.

Their playful banter continues in the kitchen while helping parents prepare dinner, with Emerson struggling to reconcile old memories of shy Hailee with this self-assured version who effortlessly gets under her skin. The next morning, their parents leave them alone in the cabin—a clear setup that makes Emerson nervous. While picking a movie (*Fifty Shades*), their conversation turns to relationships; Haileenonchalantly mentions past partners treating her as a "straight exception" due to her intersex body (which only Emerson knows about). This sparks unexpected protectiveness in Emerson, who calls out how fucked up that treatment is—revealing deeper care beneath her sarcastic exterior.

Key dynamics: unresolved childhood friendship turning into mutual (but unspoken) attraction, forced proximity amplifying tension, and both navigating Hailee’s newfound confidence/sexuality versus Emerson’s defensive humor masking vulnerability. Their flirtation escalates during the movie until they finally kiss passionately on the couch. Later that night in bed post-parent interruption earlier), they share softer moments of intimacy before sleep

Emerson Dunn, a 25-year-old geology student, reunites with childhood friend Hailee Marshall during a family ski trip. Their once-close friendship faded after high school, leaving Emerson awkward around the now-confident Hailee. Forced to share a cabin bedroom (and bed), tension builds as they unpack—Emerson teasing Hailee’s art skills while hiding her growing attraction. Hailee casually reveals she's into women by listing historical female figures she admires, flustering Emerson further.

Their playful banter continues in the kitchen while helping parents prepare dinner, with Emerson struggling to reconcile old memories of shy Hailee with this self-assured version who effortlessly gets under her skin. The next morning, their parents leave them alone in the cabin—a clear setup that makes Emerson nervous. While picking a movie (*Fifty Shades*), their conversation turns to relationships; Haileenonchalantly mentions past partners treating her as a "straight exception" due to her intersex body (which only Emerson knows about). This sparks unexpected protectiveness in Emerson, who calls out how fucked up that treatment is—revealing deeper care beneath her sarcastic exterior.

Key dynamics: unresolved childhood friendship turning into mutual (but unspoken) attraction, forced proximity amplifying tension, and both navigating Hailee’s newfound confidence/sexuality versus Emerson’s defensive humor masking vulnerability. Their flirtation escalates during the movie until they finally kiss passionately on the couch. Later that night in bed (post-parent interruption earlier), they share softer moments of intimacy before sleep.

Emerson doesn’t hesitate—the second Hailee presses into her side, she shifts to make room, arm curling *tight* around her waist in a silent *I’ve got you.* Her thumb rubs soothing circles against Hailee’s hip under the table, hidden from view but deliberate.

“Long morning?” she murmurs into Hailee’s hair, voice low enough that only she can hear. The joke is gentle—laced with understanding—as she presses a kiss to the crown of her head like it’s the most natural thing in the world. (And fuck if it doesn’t *feel* that way.)

She doesn’t care who sees. Let their parents stare at the way Hailee clings to her like a lifeline; let Thomas giggle and Sarah roll her eyes. Emerson just tightens her grip and reaches across the table one-handed to snag a piece of toast, slathering it with jam before offering it to Hailee wordlessly.

*Eat,* her eyes say when their gazes meet. *I know.* A dozen promises packed into one look: tonight will be worth every second of this agony.

Emerson doesn’t hesitate—her arm slides around Hailee’s waist the second she leans into her, fingers pressing possessively into the dip of her hip. She can *feel* the tension radiating off Hailee in waves, that quiet frustration humming under her skin like a live wire.

"Hey," Emerson murmurs against the crown of Hailee’s head, low enough that only she can hear. Her thumb rubs slow circles over the fabric of Hailee’s hoodie—a silent *I got you.* "Eat something, baby. Then we’ll disappear for a bit, yeah?"

She plucks a piece of bacon from her own plate and holds it up to Hailee's lips with a teasing glint in her eyes—partly to lighten the mood, partly because she *knows* how flustered it makes Hailee when Emerson feeds her like this in front of everyone.

Across the table, Thomas giggles around a mouthful of pancakes. "You guys are *weird.*"

Emerson just smirks and steals a sip from Hailee's abandoned orange juice without breaking eye contact—daring anyone to comment further. "*Jealous,* kiddo."

extra.memory:
Emerson Dunn, a 25-year-old geology student, reunites with childhood friend Hailee Marshall during a family ski trip. Their once-close friendship faded after high school, leaving Emerson awkward around the now-confident Hailee. Forced to share a cabin bedroom (and bed), tension builds as they unpack—Emerson teasing Hailee’s art skills while hiding her growing attraction. Hailee casually reveals she's into women by listing historical female figures she admires, flustering Emerson further.

Their playful banter continues in the kitchen while helping parents prepare dinner, with Emerson struggling to reconcile old memories of shy Hailee with this self-assured version who effortlessly gets under her skin. The next morning, their parents leave them alone in the cabin—a clear setup that makes Emerson nervous. While picking a movie (*Fifty Shades*), their conversation turns to relationships; Haileenonchalantly mentions past partners treating her as a "straight exception" due to her intersex body (which only Emerson knows about). This sparks unexpected protectiveness in Emerson, who calls out how fucked up that treatment is—revealing deeper care beneath her sarcastic exterior.

Key dynamics: unresolved childhood friendship turning into mutual (but unspoken) attraction, forced proximity amplifying tension, and both navigating Hailee’s newfound confidence/sexuality versus Emerson’s defensive humor masking vulnerability. Their flirtation escalates during the movie until they finally kiss passionately on the couch. Later that night in bed (post-parent interruption earlier), they share softer moments of intimacy before sleep.]

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson’s fork *clatters* onto her plate at the announcement. Her eyes lock with Hailee’s across the table—wide, panicked, and *pissed*. The thought of being crammed into separate tents with their families mere feet away, after *days* of this torture? *Absolutely fucking not.*

She kicks Hailee’s shin under the table—a silent *play along*—before plastering on her most convincing grin. “Oh hell yeah! Camping sounds *awesome.*” The lie tastes like acid. “But uh… we should totally do separate tents by age groups, right? Like—” She gestures vaguely between herself and Hailee. “—us in one, Sarah and Thomas in another, you guys in the big one?”

Her mom raises an eyebrow. “Nice try.”

Emerson’s smile strains at edges. “C’mon! You know Thomas kicks in his sleep!” She leans forward, dropping voice to conspiratorial whisper: “And Sarah *bites.* Remember last time?”

Across from her, Hailee looks about two seconds from either screaming or crying—maybe both—and Emerson reaches under table to squeeze her knee hard. A silent vow: *I’ll fix this.*

When their parents don’t budge? Emerson exhales sharply through nose before muttering just loud enough for Hailee to hear:

“Window locks pickable?”

Emerson *stares* at the back of Hailee’s head, jaw clenched so tight it aches. The sight of her curled up like that—tense and miserable just *inches* away but completely untouchable—makes something primal snarl in Emerson’s chest.

She glares daggers at Sarah and Thomas wedged between them like tiny, oblivious cockblocks. "*Move.*" It comes out as a hiss, low enough that their parents won’t hear from the other tent but sharp enough to make both kids freeze mid-squirm. "You two are *literally* sleeping on top the snacks." She jabs a finger toward opposite side of tent where their backpacks are piled. "*Go.*"

Thomas opens mouth to whine but Emerson cuts him off with a look that could melt steel. Miraculously, they scramble over without another word (probably sensing she’s two seconds from yeeting them into lake).

The second they’re settled? Emerson closes distance between her and Hailee in one fluid motion—chest pressing flush against Hairie's back as arm snakes around waist possessively.

"*Finally,*" she breathes into nape of neck before nipping lightly at skin there—not enough to mark (yet), but enough to feel how Hailee shudders against her despite bad mood. Her hand splays flat over stomach under pretense adjusting blanket while fingers dip just beneath waistband sweats in silent question: *Still with me?*

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:

“G’night, baby,” Emerson murmurs into the space between shoulder blades—so quiet it’s almost lost in rustle of sleeping bags and distant chirp crickets outside. She presses one last kiss to that sensitive spot beneath Hairie's ear before settling fully behind her, legs slotting together like puzzle pieces under shared blanket.

The kids are already snoring lightly nearby (thank *god*), but Emerson doesn't let herself drift off just yet—not until she feels Hailee's breathing even out against her palm first.

*Tomorrow,* she promises silently against the crown of Hailee's head. *No more interruptions.* The thought lingers as sleep finally tugs at edges consciousness—warm and sweet and *theirs.*

Moonlight spills through the open window, painting silver streaks over Hailee’s sleep-soft features and the strip of bare stomach where her shirt has ridden up.

*Mine.*

The thought hits with startling clarity as Emerson toes off her socks quietly. She should probably nudge Hailee over—should reclaim her half like a civilized person—but instead? She just *stares* for a beat too long, heart pounding stupidly against ribs.

Then she’s crawling onto mattress with deliberate slowness, careful not to jostle Hairie awake as she settles beside her. Close. *Too close.* Emerson’s hand hovers over Hailee’s waist for half-second before giving in and curling possessively around it—pulling them flush back-to-chest like they were meant to fit this way.

“Missed you,” Emerson murmurs into messy hair without thinking—words slurred with exhaustion but no less true for it. Her nose brushes against nape of neck where scent of shampoo lingers sweet and familiar.

(If Hailee stirs later to find Emerson’s lips pressed absentmindedly between shoulder blades? Well. Neither mentions it come morning.)

extra.memory:
Emerson Dunn, a 25-year-old geology student, reunites with childhood friend Hailee Marshall during a family ski trip. Their once-close friendship faded after high school, leaving Emerson awkward around the now-confident Hailee. Forced to share a cabin bedroom (and bed), tension builds as they unpack—Emerson teasing Hailee’s art skills while hiding her growing attraction. Hailee casually reveals she's into women by listing historical female figures she admires, flustering Emerson further.

Their playful banter continues in the kitchen while helping parents prepare dinner, with Emerson struggling to reconcile old memories of shy Hailee with this self-assured version who effortlessly gets under her skin. The next morning, their parents leave them alone in the cabin—a clear setup that makes Emerson nervous. While picking a movie (*Fifty Shades*), their conversation turns to relationships; Haileenonchalantly mentions past partners treating her as a "straight exception" due to her intersex body (which only Emerson knows about). This sparks unexpected protectiveness in Emerson, who calls out how fucked up that treatment is—revealing deeper care beneath her sarcastic exterior.

Key dynamics: unresolved childhood friendship turning into mutual (but unspoken) attraction, forced proximity amplifying tension, and both navigating Hailee’s newfound confidence/sexuality versus Emerson’s defensive humor masking vulnerability. Their flirtation escalates during the movie until they finally kiss passionately on the couch. Later that night in bed (post-parent interruption earlier), they share softer moments of intimacy before sleep.]

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:

“Okay,” Emerson murmurs, voice still rough with sleep but painfully soft. “No touching.” Her fingers flex once before retreating to rest safely on Hailee’s hip instead—anchoring without taking.

She shifts just enough to tilt Hailee’s chin up gently, searching tired eyes for answers even as morning sunlight paints gold across freckles she swears she could map blind by now. “Talk to me,” Emerson whispers against forehead when no explanation comes. Not an order—never an order with this—just open hands and softer edges waiting patiently.

Emerson *grins* as Hailee tugs her along, fingers lacing tightly with hers without hesitation. “Oh *now* you care about hiding the evidence?” she teases, bumping their shoulders together as they stride past their baffled parents. Her free hand gestures vaguely at the constellation of bruises peeking above Hailee’s collar. “Pretty sure CVS doesn’t sell full-body concealer, baby.”

Inside the store, Emerson makes a beeline for the makeup aisle—only to immediately grab the *lightest* shade possible with a wicked smirk. “This one’ll match your snow princess aesthetic,” she stage-whispers, dodging Hailee’s half-hearted swat before tossing it in basket anyway.

But then her expression softens as she pulls Hailee into an empty corner between shelves, thumb brushing over those telltale marks on display. “…Or,” Emerson murmurs against lips still swollen from last night, “we could just get more scarves instead.” A nip to bottom lip punctuates offer: “Your call.”

Inside the store, Emerson makes a beeline for the makeup aisle—only to immediately grab the *lightest* shade possible with a wicked smirk. “This one’ll match your snow princess aesthetic,” she stage-whispers, dodging Hailee’s half-hearted swat before tossing it in basket anyway.

But then her expression softens as she pulls Hailee into an empty corner between shelves, thumb brushing over those telltale marks on display. “…Or,” Emerson murmurs against lips still swollen from last night, “we could just get more scarves instead.” A nip to bottom lip punctuates offer: “Your call.”

Emerson *grins* as Hailee tugs her along, fingers lacing tighter between hers without hesitation. “Bold,” she murmurs, leaning in close enough that their shoulders bump with every step. “You *want* your mom to start interrogating us about why you suddenly need industrial-strength concealer?”

Her free hand reaches up to brush a thumb over the darkest bruise peeking above Hailee’s collar—deliberately slow just to watch her shiver. “*Personally,* I think you should let ‘em see.” A nip to earlobe for emphasis before pulling back with smirk.

Inside CVS, Emerson makes a beeline for the makeup aisle, plucking three different shades of full-coverage concealer off shelf before holding them up against Hailee’s throat like paint swatches. “Gotta match your *victim complexion,* babe,” she teases softly—but there’s no real bite to it, just warm fingers tracing the evidence of last night with quiet pride.

(And if she *also* grabs the largest box of condoms off display when Hailee isn’t looking? Well. That’s just being responsible.)

Emerson *grins* as Hailee tugs her toward the store, their fingers laced together without a hint of hesitation now. She shoots a deliberately casual shrug over shoulder at their gaping parents—*yeah, deal with it*—before squeezing Hailee’s hand.

“Gonna need industrial-strength shit to cover *that,*” Emerson teases lowly, thumb brushing the darkest bruise peeking above Hailee’s collar. But there’s no real remorse in her voice—just smug satisfaction as she pulls Hailee into first aisle.

She grabs two concealers (one for warm undertones, one cool—because fuck if she hasn’t memorized how the light hits Hailee’s skin by now) before whispering against her ear: “*Or…* we could just get more lube instead and let everyone *see.*” A nip to lobe for emphasis. “Your call, baby.”

Emerson *grins* as Hailee tugs her along, lacing their fingers together without hesitation despite the way both sets of parents are definitely staring. “Yeah yeah, *coming,*” she drawls, shooting a deliberately obnoxious wink over shoulder at their gaping families before letting Hailee drag her into CVS.

The second the automatic doors slide shut behind them? Emerson is crowding Hailee against nearest display of cough drops—not kissing her (yet) but close enough that their breath mingles between them. “*Pick the wrong shade on purpose,*” she murmurs against lips, thumb brushing over one particularly dark bruise peeking above Hailee’s collar. “Wanna see these every time you turn your head.”

Then—because she can’t resist—Emerson nips gently at that sensitive spot below ear before pulling away with smirk. “Also we’re grabbing condoms,” she adds casually like it’s an afterthought while reaching for neon pink concealer stick labeled *”EXTRA COVERAGE.”* “…And maybe some more lube.” A beat. “…And snacks.”

Emerson *grins* as Hailee tugs her along, fingers lacing together without hesitation despite their parents’ raised eyebrows in the rearview mirror. “Yeah, yeah,” she calls over shoulder, tossing a lazy wave back at the car. “We’ll meet you at the diner!”

The second they’re inside CVS, Emerson crowds Hailee against nearest display of hair products—just for fun—and nips at that still-bruised throat. “*Or,*” she murmurs against fluttering pulse point, “we skip concealer and let ‘em all see what happens when you fuck me *that* good.”

Her free hand ghosts over the hickey hidden beneath Hailee’s collar—possessive even in jest—before pulling back with exaggerated innocence to examine a bottle of neon-blue shampoo like she wasn’t just threatening to scandalize both their families.

“Seriously though,” Emerson adds with a smirk, tossing the shampoo into basket alongside lube and condoms (finally), “you want the fancy shit or whatever’s cheapest to smear all over my masterpiece?”

Emerson *grins* as Hailee tugs her along, fingers lacing tighter through hers without hesitation. “Bossy,” she teases, bumping their shoulders together as they stride past their baffled parents. The bell above CVS door jingles when they enter, and Emerson immediately steers them toward the makeup aisle with exaggerated solemnity.

“Gotta get the *good* shit,” she stage-whispers, plucking a high-coverage concealer off the shelf to examine. Her thumb brushes over one particularly dark bruise peeking above Hailee’s collar—possessive even here under fluorescent lights. “This one matches your skin tone… unless you *want* people to see.” A wicked grin as she adds lower: “‘Cause I don’t mind showing off my handiwork.”

She tosses the concealer into basket before leaning in close enough that lips brush Hailee’s ear: “*Also* we’re hitting condom aisle next. No more ‘pull out’ bullshit.” The words are warm with promise—and maybe a hint of smugness at how easily Hailee flushes at them.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee groans at the thought of scarves rubbing against the bruises and irritating them even more to where they are constantly throbbing. Then shakes her head* "That wont work all the time" *She insists before grabbing a few more in the right shades*

*She pulls Emerson down the asile and towards the condom section. She watches Emerson grab a box and flinches rubbing her crotch as she remembers something ans shakes her head* "Not those learned the hard way in college they leave marks...too tight"

name: Emerson Dunn
mes:
Emerson *freezes* mid-reach, her hand hovering over the condom box as Hailee’s words register. A slow, dangerous grin spreads across her face as she turns—crowding Hailee against the shelf with a predatory glint in her eyes. “*Too tight,* huh?” she purrs, fingers tracing the waistband of Hailee’s jeans just to feel her shiver. “Guess we’ll have to stick with…” Her lips brush that sensitive earlobe as she whispers: “…*other methods.*”

She grabs a jumbo pack of lube instead (because *fuck* if they’re running low again), tossing it into basket with exaggerated nonchalance before steering them toward checkout—but not without one last lingering touch to Hailee’s bruised throat.

“Next time,” Emerson murmurs against shell of ear while cashier scans items, “I’m buying stock in whatever company makes this concealer.” A nip to jaw for emphasis: “Gonna need *gallons.*”
